jurisdiction.title: Holy Spirit Catholic School Division - Alberta, Canada

1EAE091568E74374A163D74CC91A0C04.description: Discuss how dance experiences can benefit individuals or communities.

F8639AC5E71C45DF91DCA5A7F45FFDBA.description: Observe a variety of Metis jigs and compare the movements to French-Canadian and Scottish dances.

8355CFAACA07478A8CBFDF8230ED5BF9.description: Observe a variety of First Nations, Metis, and Inuit dances as an inspiration for talking about dance

126022681F614216AA96DC57F1CADB0D.description: Dances from various times and places can be representative of a culture.

7892D1CC941545AF95BC22E98565BEC5.description: Culture is what people do and a way of thinking.

049FD0F3B88142138F88BF5F89FBD5B4.description: Metis jigging reflects cultural styles related to French-Canadian and Scottish dance.

D5CCF192A50E468280DE5FEBD485D316.description: First Nations, Metis, and Inuit dance is holistic in nature and can have individual and collective benefits, including social well-being physical health spiritual connection emotional and mental well-being intellectual development

C57759E66F834C4D99F24532695C36FE.description: Inuit drum dances are cultural practices that are practised for a variety of reasons.

766C8F1F851B404CA299BF208A45CC7B.description: First Nations powwow dances can be performed to honor and demonstrate a connection to land.

AFA187211B1A46C28BEB9C38532B145C.description: Singing was an important part of dance in ancient Greece and is still used in dance performances today.

8FB3DB0E91DC4D998E1EFB9BE95F1482.description: Circle dances, known as ring dances, were commonly performed in ancient Greece, with dancers holding hands as they danced around a musician.

8AD3C9D00EDF4385A166352D25143925.description: The formations and pathways of dances in ancient Greece included the circle, line, and serpentine

8C8A2CBB5A1B434AB04C36BE89EC313D.description: The god Dionysus valued fast and lively dance, whereas the god Apollo valued slow and ceremonial dance.

7B75D644378F47B394A4950C75BC7C2B.description: Ancient Greek dance was inspired by gods and goddesses.

178067222B6E43BA80300DD15C294607.description: Ancient Greeks valued dance and believed that it was the most beautiful part of life.

2C8CB4574D8848478C3E1384F9E91A9E.description: Experiences with dance can include learning about dances from the past and the people who created and performed them.

A8BD7617D91B43428DC177416CF839CD.description: Students investigate culture in relation to dance from ancient Greece and present day. Students examine culture through First Nations, Metis, and Inuit dance.

782D135289FC4324BC2BF34DE87FE7C6.description: Appreciation: Recognizing beauty, goodness, and truth in dance can be developed by understanding the complexity and richness of great works of dance, the artists who create and perform them, and the historical and cultural contexts from which they originate.
